comments.author: Azariah.5897
comments.body:
How to Train Your [Kuna] presents: the Trek sorter you never knew you needed!

http://maps.trainyourkuna.org/

Usage –
1) Start your Guild Trek
2) As you start typing location names into the “Filter by name” box, the list of locations will filter down the possible matching locations.
3) Click on a location to designate it as active and reset the filter by name.
4) Repeat until you have all of your active locations selected
5) Copy a region of active locations, paste it into guild chat
6) Split up the trek locations in less time and lower your waypoint cost and completion time!

The plan is to make the map actually contain the locations of trek points over time, but I’m still working on the utility to “crowd source” trek locations. I figured this is useful enough as is to be worth posting for people, though, so here you go.

*Please note that your mileage may vary, and using this program may, in fact, somehow make treks more stressful for your guild. Hopefully, it helps, and it’s provided as-is
